questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

An administrator schedules the push of a new image to a desktop pool and receives the error shown in the exhibit.
Where should the administrator first look for the cause of the issue?

choices.D: Account used to login to the Horizon Console
choices.B: Golden Image Active Directory Computer Account

questions.question_text:
An end-user is experiencing a black screen when connecting to their virtual desktop. After a few seconds, the connection closes.
Which could be the cause of the issue? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
La respuesta es : B D E 
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1028332
Black screen issue occurs only when there is a firewall issue from client to Agent. For video memory issue the disconnects can happen after seeing the login screen. Correct Answer is D

comments.content: If they want you to choose three, you choose three.

choices.A: The Client machine video memory is too high.
choices.D: There is an incorrect firewall configuration.
choices.B: There is a vRAM shortage on the Horizon virtual machine.
choices.E: The incorrect video driver version is installed on the Horizon virtual machine.
choices.C: The Horizon Virtual Machine video memory is too high.

questions.question_text: Which two types of pools can be created in Horizon on Azure VMware Solutions (AVS)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
correct it's vsphere on Azure so the same as we have on Prem

questions.question_text:
When trying to connect to the Connection Server using HTML access on Internet Explorer 11, a user sees a message stating that the server expects to receive login credentials from another application or server. The Connection Server instance is paired with a SAML 2.0 authentication server with a signed CA certificate.
What could be the cause of the issue?

choices.C: Workspace ONE mode is enabled on the Connection Server instance.
choices.A: Internet Explorer 11 does not support HTML Access.
choices.B: HTML access is not allowed if the Connection Server is paired with an SAML 2.0 authentication server.
choices.D: HTML access is disabled by the CA certificate.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I'm pretty sure this answer is not B but its C.. 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-HTML-Access/2103/html-access-installation/GUID-1796F55F-2297-4372-A58C-EDCDDC25CC50.html

questions.question_text:
An administrator configures VMware Dynamic Environment Manager's Logon and Logoff tasks to load two PowerShell scripts on boot and logoff, but has noticed the scripts are not loading.
What could be the cause of the issue?

choices.A: URL Content Redirection policy needs to be configured.
choices.D: PCoIP needs to be used instead of Blast.
choices.B: Clipboard redirection policy needs to be configured.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It has to be C. DEM works when logging into the VM directly through vCenter and has nothing to do with the client connection protocol.
